verses.verse: (God’s Appeal to Stubborn Israel) To the leader: according to The Gittith. Of Asaph. (Ps 59.16; 66.1) Sing aloud to God our strength; shout for joy to the God of Jacob.
Raise a song; sound the tambourine, the sweet lyre with the harp.
(Lev 23.24; Num 10.10) Blow the trumpet at the new moon, at the full moon, on our festal day.
For it is a statute for Israel, an ordinance of the God of Jacob.
(Ex 11.4) He made it a decree in Joseph, when he went out over (Or against) the land of Egypt. I hear a voice I had not known:
(Isa 9.4; 10.27) “I relieved your (Heb his) shoulder of the burden; your (Heb his) hands were freed from the basket.
(Ex 2.23; 17.6, 7; 19.19; Ps 50.15) In distress you called, and I rescued you; I answered you in the secret place of thunder; I tested you at the waters of Meribah. Selah
(Ps 50.7) Hear, O my people, while I admonish you; O Israel, if you would but listen to me!
(Deut 32.12; Isa 43.12) There shall be no strange god among you; you shall not bow down to a foreign god.
(Ex 20.2; Ps 103.5) I am the LORD your God, who brought you up out of the land of Egypt. Open your mouth wide, and I will fill it.
(Ex 32.1) “But my people did not listen to my voice; Israel would not submit to me.
(Acts 7.42; Rom 1.24) So I gave them over to their stubborn hearts, to follow their own counsels.
(Deut 5.29; Ps 128.1; Isa 48.18) O that my people would listen to me, that Israel would walk in my ways!
(Ps 47.3; Am 1.8) Then I would quickly subdue their enemies and turn my hand against their foes.
Those who hate the LORD would cringe before him, and their doom would last forever.
(Deut 32.13; Ps 147.14) I would feed you (Cn: Heb he would feed him) with the finest of the wheat, and with honey from the rock I would satisfy you.”
